summary: The Save Healthcare Workers Act aims to protect hospital personnel from violence. The bill amends Title 18 of the United States Code to criminalize assault of hospital employees engaged in duties at the hospital. Penalties include fines and imprisonment, with enhanced penalties for acts involving dangerous weapons, serious bodily injury, or those committed during public emergency declarations. The bill also includes an affirmative defense for individuals with disabilities and mandates a GAO study to assess the Act's impact on workplace violence, including prosecution rates.
